member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.BitmapBuffer
member.summary: Represents a buffer of bytes containing pixels in BGRA byte order loaded from an image that is passed on to the constructor. Data contains all the raw bytes (without scanline left-over bytes) where they can be quickly changed and then a new bitmap can be created from the byte data.

member.name: F:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.BitmapBuffer.BytesPerPixel
member.summary: A constant representing the number of bytes per pixel in the pixel data. This is always 4 but it is kept here for readability.

member.name: F:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.BitmapBuffer.BOffset
member.summary: The blue byte offset within a pixel offset. This is 0.

member.name: F:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.BitmapBuffer.GOffset
member.summary: The green byte offset within a pixel offset. This is 1.

member.name: F:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.BitmapBuffer.ROffset
member.summary: The red byte offset within a pixel offset. This is 2.

member.name: F:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.BitmapBuffer.AOffset
member.summary: The alpha byte offset within a pixel offset. This is 3.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.BitmapBuffer.#ctor(System.Drawing.Image)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Data will not contain left-over stride bytes.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.BitmapBuffer.Data
member.summary: Contains all the bytes of the pixel data Each horizontal scanline is represented by LineLength rather than by LinceStride. The left-over stride bytes are removed.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.BitmapBuffer.ImageWidth
member.summary: Gets the width of the image.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.BitmapBuffer.ImageHeight
member.summary: Gets the height of the image.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.BitmapBuffer.PixelFormat
member.summary: Gets the pixel format. This will always be Format32bppArgb.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.BitmapBuffer.LineStride
member.summary: Gets the length in bytes of a line of pixel data. Basically the same as Line Length except Stride might be a little larger as some bitmaps might be DWORD-algned.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.BitmapBuffer.LineLength
member.summary: Gets the length in bytes of a line of pixel data. Basically the same as Stride except Stride might be a little larger as some bitmaps might be DWORD-algned.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.BitmapBuffer.GetPixelOffset(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the index of the first byte in the BGRA pixel data for the given image coordinates.
member.returns: Index of the first byte in the BGRA pixel.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.BitmapBuffer.ToBitmap
member.summary: Converts the pixel data bytes held in the buffer to a 32-bit RGBA bitmap.
member.returns: Pixel data for a graphics image and its attribute.

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredSensor
member.summary: Implements a digital infrared sensor using the HX1838/VS1838 or the TSOP38238 38kHz digital receiver. It registers an interrupt on the pin and fires data events asynchronously to keep CPU usage low. Some primitive ideas taken from https://github.com/adafruit/IR-Commander/blob/master/ircommander.pde and https://github.com/z3t0/Arduino-IRremote/blob/master/IRremote.cpp.

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredSensor.InfraredPulse
member.summary: Represents data of an infrared pulse.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Called when an infrared sensor raw data buffer becomes available.

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredSensor.NecDecoder
member.summary: Provides decoding Methods for the NEC IR Protocol. Idea taken from here: https://www.sbprojects.net/knowledge/ir/nec.php.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredSensor.NecDecoder.DecodePulses(Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredSensor.InfraredPulse[])
member.summary: Decodes the IR pulses according to the NEC protocol. If the train of pulses does not match the protocol, then it returns a null byte array. If the train of pulses is a repeat code, then it returns a 4-byte array with all bits set.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredSensor.NecDecoder.IsRepeatCode(Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredSensor.InfraredPulse[])
member.summary: Determines whether the set of pulses represent a repeat code.
member.returns: true if the train of pulses represents an NEC repeat code.

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.LedStripAPA102C
member.summary: Represents an SPI addressable strip of RGB LEDs Model number APA102C This strip is also known as Adafruit DotStar LED strip (just a new name for an existing item) You can get it here: https://www.adafruit.com/products/2239 or here: https://www.aliexpress.com/wholesale?SearchText=APA102C.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.LedStripAPA102C.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: if set to true colors will be sent to the strip as BGR, otherwise as RGB.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.LedStripAPA102C.ReverseRgb
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether RGB values are sent as GBR This is typically true.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.LedStripAPA102C.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the at the specified index.
member.returns: A reference to the strip pixel.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.LedStripAPA102C.ClearPixels
member.summary: Clears all the pixels. Call the Render method to apply the changes.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.LedStripAPA102C.GetPixel(System.Int32)
member.returns: A refrence to the stip pixel.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.LedStripAPA102C.SetPixel(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Sets the pixel brightness, R, G and B at the given index. And invalid index has no effect.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.LedStripAPA102C.SetPixels(Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.BitmapBuffer,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets a number of pixels from loaded pixel data directly into the frame buffer This is the fastest method to set a number of pixels. Call the Render Method to apply!.
member.param: The pixel data of a previously loaded bitmap.
The x offset in the bitmap to start copying pixels from.
The row index (y) from which to take the pixel data.
The brightness from 0.0 to 1.0. The underlying precision is from 0 to 31.
The target offset where to start setting the pixels.
The number of pixels to set. 0 or less means the entire LedCount.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.LedStripAPA102C.Render
member.summary: Renders all the pixels in the FrameBuffer.

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.LedStripAPA102C.LedStripPixel
member.summary: Represents an LED in a strip of LEDs This class is not meant to be instantiated by the user.

member.summary: Gets or sets the brightness, from 0 to 1.

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.LogicProbe
member.summary: A class representing a logic probe that reads high or low digital values when an edge change is detected. This is not meant for high frequency probing. The maximum fairly reliable probing frequency is at most 10kHz (100us periods).

member.summary: Read and write different types of Radio-Frequency IDentification (RFID) cards on your Raspberry Pi using a RC522 based reader connected via the Serial Peripheral Interface (SPI) interface.
